term.title: Bingham flow

item.text: Many colloidal dispersions show Bingham flow which is characterized by a σ-D diagram as shown. At rates of shear greater than that at point A, the following relation applies: σ- σ B = η Δ D (or τ B) is called the Bingham yield stress, η Δ is the differential viscosity, D is the shear rate, and σ is the average of three normal stress components if the deformation is purely dilatational. [image: Not defined]

item.alttext: σ- σ B = η Δ D
